oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Appalachian Exposition pennant postcard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pennant Card. Appalachian Exposition postcard with felt pennant attached to front. On front: “I’m Tickled to Death with Appalachian Exposition And am Having “a Time” Every Night.” The word ‘Knoxville’ is printed on the pennant. Drawing of a grinning cat also pictured on the front. On the back, addressed to Miss Nell Givens, Uniontown, KY. Aunt Maude. Postmarked Knoxville, Tenn. Sep. 27, 1911. One cent stamp. Lewis Publishing Co., Pittsburgh, Pa. 1 postcard. Filed in Postcard Collection under Knoxville>Chilhowee Park / Expositions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Postcards; Humorous pictures; Fairs; Cats; Pennants;
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Filed in Postcard Collection under Knoxville>Chilhowee Park / Expositions.
